body: @normanmaurer well, it does read the file internally :) Consider either pre-loading it or adding `io.netty.handler.ssl.ReferenceCountedOpenSslClientContext$ExtendedTrustManagerVerifyCallback.verify` to the list of allowed methods
@bsideup adding this extra method sounds like good enough... @bsideup @violetagg want to do a PR ?

> @bsideup adding this extra method sounds like good enough... @bsideup @violetagg want to do a PR ?

Yep sure

issue.title: Do not report ReferenceCountedOpenSslClientContext$ExtendedTrustManag…

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
…erVerifyCallback.verify as blocking call

Motivation:

When BlockHound is installed,
ReferenceCountedOpenSslClientContext$ExtendedTrustManagerVerifyCallback.verify
is reported as blocking call.

Modifications:

Add allowBlockingCallsInside configuration for
ReferenceCountedOpenSslClientContext$ExtendedTrustManagerVerifyCallback.verify

Result:

Fixes #10384

issue.title: Blockhound detects a blocking call for HTTPs connections

labels.name: for/netty
labels.description: This belongs to the Netty project

repository.name: reactor-netty
repository.description: TCP/HTTP/UDP/QUIC client/server with Reactor over Netty

issue.body:
Hi all, I am getting blocking call using Blockhound over
java.base/sun.security.ssl.X509TrustManagerImpl.checkServerTrusted.

```
Caused by: reactor.blockhound.BlockingOperationError: Blocking call! java.io.FileInputStream#readBytes

        at java.base/java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.base/sun.security.util.UntrustedCertificates.<clinit>(UntrustedCertificates.java:54)
        at java.base/sun.security.provider.certpath.UntrustedChecker.check(UntrustedChecker.java:78)
```
